scenario:
Booking Holdings presented its fourth-quarter 2024 earnings call on February 20, 2025, with CEO Glenn Fogel marking his 25th year at the company. Key insights for investors include:

- The company exceeded financial targets across key metrics, with gross bookings of $166 billion increasing 10% versus 2023 and revenue of $24 billion growing 11% year over year. Adjusted EBITDA of over $8 billion increased 17% year over year, with adjusted EBITDA margins growing by 170 basis points to 35%.

- Booking is taking a proactive approach to AI disruption by developing proprietary capabilities while forming partnerships with major AI companies. The company is leveraging AI to improve operational efficiency, particularly in customer service, and aims to protect its market position regardless of how consumer booking preferences evolve.

- The company's merchant platform expansion creates strategic opportunities, with merchant gross bookings reaching 59% of total gross bookings at Booking.com in 2024, an increase of about 9 percentage points year over year.

- Alternative accommodations growth is outpacing the core business, with listings at the end of Q4 reaching 7.9 million, up about 8% from last year. Alternative accommodations bookings increased 19% in the fourth quarter, accelerating from 14% growth in the previous quarter.

- Booking announced a comprehensive efficiency program while maintaining investment in strategic growth initiatives, with the company's transformation program expected to deliver $400 million to $450 million in annual run-rate cost savings when fully implemented.

- Management remains focused on advancing their connected trip vision, expanding merchant and fintech capabilities, enhancing their loyalty program, and leveraging AI for both customer experience improvements and operational efficiencies.
